5.verse: Do not bow down to them or worship them. I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God. I cause the sins of the parents to affect their children. I will cause the sins of those who hate me to affect even their grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

6.verse: But for all time to come I show love to all those who love me and keep my commandments.

7.verse: “Do not misuse the name of the LORD your God. The LORD will find guilty anyone who misuses his name.

8.verse: “Remember to keep the Sabbath day holy.

9.verse: Do all your work in six days.

10.verse: But the seventh day is a sabbath to honor the LORD your God. Do not do any work on that day. The same command applies to your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, and your animals. It also applies to any outsiders who live in your towns.

11.verse: In six days the LORD made the heavens, the earth, the sea and everything in them. But he rested on the seventh day. So the LORD blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.

12.verse: “Honor your father and mother. Then you will live a long time in the land the LORD your God is giving you.

13.verse: “Do not murder.

14.verse: “Do not commit adultery.

15.verse: “Do not steal.

16.verse: “Do not be a false witness against your neighbor.

17.verse: “Do not want to have anything your neighbor owns. Do not want to have your neighbor’s house, wife, male or female servant, ox or donkey.”

18.verse: The people saw the thunder and lightning. They heard the trumpet. They saw the mountain covered with smoke. They trembled with fear and stayed a long way off.

19.verse: They said to Moses, “Speak to us yourself. Then we’ll listen. But don’t let God speak to us. If he does, we’ll die.”

20.verse: Moses said to the people, “Don’t be afraid. God has come to test you. He wants you to have respect for him. That will keep you from sinning.”

21.verse: Moses approached the thick darkness where God was. But the people remained a long way off.

22.verse: Worship the LORD - Then the LORD said to Moses, “Here is what you must tell the people of Israel. Say to them, ‘You have seen for yourselves what I said to you from heaven.

23.verse: Do not put any other gods in place of me. Do not make silver or gold statues of them for yourselves.

24.verse: “ ‘Make an altar out of dirt for me. Sacrifice your burnt offerings and friendship offerings on it. Sacrifice your sheep, goats and cattle on it. I will come to you and bless you everywhere I cause my name to be honored.

25.verse: If you make an altar out of stones to honor me, do not build it with blocks of stone. You will make it “unclean” if you use a tool on it.

26.verse: Do not walk up steps to my altar. If you do, someone might see your naked body under your robes.’

1.verse: Other Laws - “Here are the laws you must explain to the people of Israel.

2.verse: Set Your Hebrew Servants Free “Suppose you buy a Hebrew servant. He must serve you for six years. But in the seventh year, you must set him free. He does not have to pay anything.

3.verse: If he does not have a wife when he comes, he must go free alone. But if he has a wife when he comes, she must go with him.

4.verse: Suppose his master gives him a wife. And suppose she has sons or daughters by him. Then only the man will go free. The woman and her children will belong to her master.

5.verse: “But suppose the servant says, ‘I love my master and my wife and children. I don’t want to go free.’

6.verse: Then his master must take him to the judges. His master must take him to the door or doorpost of his master’s house. His master must poke a hole through his servant’s earlobe into the door or doorpost. Then he will become his servant for life.

7.verse: “Suppose a man sells his daughter as a servant. Then she can’t go free as male servants do.

8.verse: But what if the master who has chosen her does not like her? Then he must let the man buy her back. He has no right to sell her to strangers. He has broken his promise to her.

9.verse: What if he chooses her to marry his son? Then he must grant her the rights of a daughter.

10.verse: What if her master marries another woman? He must still give the first one her food and clothes and sleep with her.

11.verse: If he does not provide her with those three things, she can go free. She does not have to pay anything.

12.verse: Laws About Harming Others “Anyone who hits and kills someone else must be put to death.

13.verse: Suppose they did not do it on purpose. Suppose I let it happen. Then they can escape to a place I will choose.

14.verse: But suppose they kill someone on purpose. Then take them away from my altar and put them to death.

15.verse: “Anyone who attacks their father or mother must be put to death.

16.verse: “Anyone who kidnaps and sells another person must be put to death. If they still have the person with them when they are caught, they must be put to death.

17.verse: “Anyone who asks for something bad to happen to their father or mother must be put to death.

18.verse: “Suppose two people get into a fight and argue with each other. One hits the other with a stone or his fist. And the person who was hit does not die but has to stay in bed.

19.verse: And later that person gets up and walks around outside with a walking stick. Then the person who hit the other person will not be held responsible. But that person must pay the one who was hurt for the time spent in bed. The one who hit the other person must be sure that person is completely healed.

20.verse: “Suppose a person beats their male or female slave to death with a club. That person must be punished.

21.verse: But they will not be punished if the slave gets up after a day or two. After all, the slave is their property.

22.verse: “Suppose some people are fighting and one of them hits a pregnant woman. And suppose she has her baby early but is not badly hurt. Then the one who hurt her must pay a fine. That person must pay what the woman’s husband asks for and the court allows.

23.verse: But if someone is badly hurt, a life must be taken for a life.

24.verse: An eye must be put out for an eye. A tooth must be knocked out for a tooth. A hand must be cut off for a hand and a foot for a foot.

25.verse: A burn must be given for a burn, a wound for a wound, and a bruise for a bruise.

26.verse: “Suppose an owner hits a male or female slave in the eye and destroys it. Then the owner must let the slave go free to pay for the eye.

27.verse: Suppose an owner knocks out the tooth of a male or female slave. Then he must let the slave go free to pay for the tooth.

28.verse: “Suppose a bull kills a man or woman with its horns. Then you must kill the bull by throwing stones at it. Its meat must not be eaten. But the owner of the bull will not be held accountable.

29.verse: But suppose the bull has had the habit of attacking people. And suppose the owner has been warned but has not kept it fenced in. Then if it kills a man or woman, you must kill it with stones. The owner must also be put to death.

30.verse: But suppose payment is required of him instead. Then the owner can save his life by paying what is required.

31.verse: The same law applies if the bull wounds a son or daughter with its horns.

32.verse: Suppose the bull wounds a male or female slave. Then the owner must pay the slave’s master about 12 ounces of silver. You must kill the bull with stones.

33.verse: “Suppose someone uncovers a pit or digs one and does not cover it. And suppose an ox or donkey falls into it.

34.verse: Then the person who opened the pit must pay the animal’s owner for the loss. The dead animal will belong to the person who opened the pit.

35.verse: “Suppose someone’s bull wounds a neighbor’s bull and it dies. Then the owner and the neighbor must sell the live one. And they must share the money and the dead animal equally.

36.verse: But suppose people knew that the bull had the habit of attacking. And suppose the owner did not keep it fenced in. Then the owner must give another animal to pay for the dead animal. And the dead animal will belong to the owner.

1.verse: Laws About Keeping Property Safe “Suppose someone steals an ox or a sheep. And suppose that person kills it or sells it. Then the thief must pay back five oxen for the ox. Or the thief must pay back four sheep for the sheep.

2.verse: “Suppose you catch a thief breaking into your house at night. And suppose you hit the thief and the thief dies. Then you are not guilty of murder.

3.verse: But suppose it happens after the sun has come up. Then you are guilty of murder. “Anyone who steals must pay for whatever they steal. But suppose the thief does not have anything. Then the thief must be sold to pay for what was stolen.

4.verse: What if the stolen ox, donkey or sheep is found alive with the thief? Then the thief must pay back twice as much.

5.verse: “Suppose someone lets their livestock eat grass in someone else’s field or vineyard. Then they must pay that person back from the best crops of their own field or vineyard.

6.verse: “Suppose a fire breaks out and spreads into bushes. Suppose it burns cut and stacked grain or grain that is still growing. Or suppose it burns the whole field. Then the one who started the fire must pay for the loss.

7.verse: “Suppose someone gives a neighbor silver or other things to keep safe. And suppose they are stolen from the neighbor’s house. The thief, if caught, must pay back twice as much as was stolen.

8.verse: But suppose the thief is not found. Then the neighbor must go to the judges. They will decide whether the neighbor has stolen the other person’s property.

9.verse: Suppose you have an ox, donkey, sheep or clothing that does not belong to you. Or you have other property lost by someone else. And suppose someone says, ‘That belongs to me.’ Then both people must bring their case to the judges. The one the judges decide is guilty must pay back twice as much to the other person.

10.verse: “Suppose someone asks their neighbor to take care of a donkey, ox, sheep or any other animal. And suppose the animal dies or gets hurt. Or suppose it is stolen while no one is looking.

11.verse: Then the problem will be settled by promising the LORD to tell the truth. Suppose the neighbor says, ‘I didn’t steal your property.’ Then the owner must accept what the neighbor says. No payment is required.

12.verse: But suppose the animal really was stolen. Then the neighbor must pay the owner back.

13.verse: Or suppose it was torn to pieces by a wild animal. Then the neighbor must bring in what is left as proof. No payment is required.

14.verse: “Suppose someone borrows an animal from their neighbor. And it gets hurt or dies while the owner is not there. Then the borrower must pay for it.

15.verse: But suppose the owner is with the animal. Then the borrower will not have to pay. If the borrower hired the animal, the money paid to hire it covers the loss.

16.verse: Laws About Social Problems “Suppose a man meets a virgin who is not engaged. And he talks her into having sex with him. Then he must pay her father the price for a bride. And he must marry her.

17.verse: But suppose her father absolutely refuses to give her to him. Then he must still pay the price for getting married to a virgin.

18.verse: “Do not let a woman who does evil magic stay alive. Put her to death.

19.verse: “Anyone who has sex with an animal must be put to death.

20.verse: “Anyone who sacrifices to any god other than the LORD must be destroyed.

21.verse: “Do not treat outsiders badly. Do not give them a hard time. Remember, you were outsiders in Egypt.

22.verse: “Do not take advantage of widows. Do not take advantage of children whose fathers have died.

23.verse: If you do, they might cry out to me. I will certainly hear them.

24.verse: And I will get angry. I will kill you with a sword. Your wives will become widows. Your children’s fathers will die.

25.verse: “Suppose you lend money to one of my people among you who is in need. Then do not treat it like a business deal. Do not charge any interest at all.

26.verse: Suppose your neighbor owes you money and gives you a coat as a promise to pay it back. Then return it by sunset.

27.verse: That coat is the only thing your neighbor owns to wear or sleep in. When they cry out to me, I will listen, because I am loving and kind.

28.verse: “Do not speak evil things against God. Do not curse the ruler of your people.

29.verse: “Do not keep for yourself your grain offerings or wine offerings. “You must give me the oldest of your sons.

30.verse: Do the same with your cattle and sheep. Let them stay with their mothers for seven days. But give them to me on the eighth day.

31.verse: “I want you to be my holy people. So do not eat the meat of any animal that has been torn by wild animals. Throw it to the dogs.

1.verse: Laws About Mercy and Fairness “Do not spread reports that are false. Do not help a guilty person by telling lies in court.

2.verse: “Do not follow the crowd when they do what is wrong. When you are a witness in court, do not turn what is right into what is wrong. Do not go along with the crowd.

3.verse: Do not show favor to a poor person in court.

4.verse: “Suppose you come across your enemy’s ox or donkey wandering away. Then be sure to return it.

5.verse: Suppose you see that the donkey of someone who hates you has fallen down under its load. Then do not leave it there. Be sure you help them with it.

6.verse: “Be fair to your poor people in their court cases.

7.verse: Do not have anything to do with a false charge. Do not put to death people not guilty of doing anything wrong. I will not let guilty people go free.

8.verse: “Do not take money from people who want special favors. It makes you blind to the truth. It twists the words of good people.

9.verse: “Do not treat outsiders badly. You yourselves know how it feels to be outsiders. Remember, you were outsiders in Egypt.

10.verse: Sabbath Laws “For six years plant your fields and gather your crops.

11.verse: But during the seventh year do not plow your land or use it. Then the poor people among you can get food from it. The wild animals can eat what is left over. Do the same thing with your vineyards and your groves of olive trees.

12.verse: “Do all your work in six days. But do not do any work on the seventh day. Then your oxen and donkeys can rest. The slaves born in your house can be renewed. And so can the outsiders who live among you.

13.verse: “Be careful to do everything I have said to you. Do not speak the names of other gods. Do not even let them be heard on your lips.

14.verse: Laws About Celebrating the Three Main Feasts “Three times a year you must celebrate a feast in my honor.

15.verse: “Celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days, eat bread made without yeast, just as I commanded you. Do it at the appointed time in the month of Aviv. You came out of Egypt in that month. “You must not come to worship me with your hands empty.

16.verse: “Celebrate the Feast of Weeks. Bring the first share of your crops from your fields. “Celebrate the Feast of Booths. Hold it in the fall when you gather in your crops from your fields.

17.verse: “Three times a year all your men must come to worship me. I am your LORD and King.

18.verse: “Do not include anything made with yeast when you offer me the blood of a sacrifice. “Suppose the fat from sacrifices is left over from my feasts. Then do not keep it until morning.

19.verse: “Bring the best of the first share of your crops to my house. I am the LORD your God. “Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.

20.verse: God’s Angel Will Prepare the Way - “I am sending an angel ahead of you. He will guard you along the way. He will bring you to the place I have prepared.

21.verse: Pay attention to him. Listen to what he says. Do not refuse to obey him. He will not forgive you if you turn against him. He has my full authority.

22.verse: Listen carefully to what he says. Do everything I say. Then I will be an enemy to your enemies. I will fight against those who fight against you.

23.verse: My angel will go ahead of you. He will bring you into the land of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hivites and Jebusites. I will wipe them out.

24.verse: Do not do what they do. Do not bow down to their gods or worship them. You must destroy the statues of their gods. You must break their sacred stones to pieces.

25.verse: Worship the LORD your God. Then he will bless your food and water. I, the LORD, will take away any sickness you may have.

26.verse: In your land no woman will give birth to a dead baby. Every woman will be able to have children. I will give you a long life.

27.verse: “I will send my terror ahead of you. I will throw every nation you meet into a panic. I will make all your enemies turn their backs and run away.

28.verse: I will send hornets ahead of you. They will drive the Hivites, Canaanites and Hittites out of your way.

29.verse: But I will not drive them out in just one year. If I did, the land would be deserted. There would be too many wild animals for you.

30.verse: I will drive them out ahead of you little by little. I will do that until there are enough of you to take control of the land.

31.verse: “I will make your borders secure from the Red Sea to the Mediterranean Sea. They will go from the desert to the Euphrates River. I will hand over to you the people who live in the land. You will drive them out to make room for yourselves.

32.verse: Do not make a covenant with them or with their gods.

33.verse: Do not let them live in your land. If you do, they will cause you to sin against me. If you worship their gods, that will certainly be a trap for you.”

1.verse: The Blood of the Covenant - The LORD said to Moses, “You and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and 70 of the elders of Israel must come to worship the LORD. Do not come close when you worship.

2.verse: Only Moses can come close to me. The others must not come near. And the people may not go up with him.”

3.verse: Moses went and told the people all the LORD’s words and laws. They answered with one voice. They said, “We will do everything the LORD has told us to do.”

4.verse: Then Moses wrote down everything the LORD had said. Moses got up early the next morning. He built an altar at the foot of the mountain. He set up 12 stone pillars. They stood for the 12 tribes of Israel.

5.verse: Then he sent young Israelite men to sacrifice burnt offerings. They also sacrificed young bulls as friendship offerings to the LORD.

6.verse: Moses put half of the blood in bowls. He splashed the other half against the altar.

7.verse: Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read it to the people. They answered, “We will do everything the LORD has told us to do. We will obey him.”

8.verse: Then Moses took the blood and sprinkled it on the people. He said, “This is the blood that puts the covenant into effect. The LORD has made this covenant with you in keeping with all these words.”

9.verse: Moses and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and the 70 elders of Israel went up.

10.verse: They saw the God of Israel. Under his feet was something like a street made out of lapis lazuli. It was as bright blue as the sky itself.

11.verse: But God didn’t destroy those Israelite leaders when they saw him. They ate and drank.

12.verse: The LORD said to Moses, “Come up to me on the mountain. Stay here. I will give you the stone tablets. They contain the law and commandments I have written to teach the people.”

13.verse: Then Moses and Joshua, his helper, started out. Moses went up on the mountain of God.

14.verse: He said to the elders, “Wait for us here until we come back to you. Aaron and Hur are with you. Anyone who has a problem can go to them.”

15.verse: Moses went up on the mountain. Then the cloud covered it.

16.verse: The glory of the LORD settled on Mount Sinai. The cloud covered the mountain for six days. On the seventh day the LORD called out to Moses from inside the cloud.

17.verse: The people of Israel saw the glory of the LORD. It looked like a fire burning on top of the mountain.

18.verse: Moses entered the cloud as he went on up the mountain. He stayed on the mountain for 40 days and 40 nights.

1.verse: Offerings for the Holy Tent - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Tell the people of Israel to bring me an offering. You must receive the offering for me from everyone whose hearts move them to give.

3.verse: “Here are the offerings you must receive from them. “gold, silver and bronze

4.verse: blue, purple and bright red yarn and fine linen goat hair

5.verse: ram skins that are dyed red another kind of strong leather acacia wood

6.verse: olive oil for the lights spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet-smelling incense

7.verse: onyx stones and other jewels for the linen apron and chest cloth

8.verse: “Have them make a sacred tent for me. I will live among them.

9.verse: Make the holy tent and everything that belongs to it. Make them exactly like the pattern I will show you.

10.verse: The Ark of the Covenant Law - “Have them make an ark out of acacia wood. It must be a chest three feet nine inches long and two feet three inches wide and high.

11.verse: Cover it inside and outside with pure gold. Put a strip of gold around it.

12.verse: Make four gold rings for it. Join them to its four bottom corners. Put two rings on one side and two rings on the other.

13.verse: Then make poles out of acacia wood. Cover them with gold.

14.verse: Put the poles through the rings on the sides of the ark to carry it.

15.verse: The poles must remain in the rings of the ark. Do not remove them.

16.verse: I will give you the tablets of the covenant law. When I do, put them into the ark.

17.verse: “Make its cover out of pure gold. The cover is the place where sin will be paid for. Make it three feet nine inches long and two feet three inches wide.

18.verse: Make two cherubim out of hammered gold at the ends of the cover.

19.verse: Put one of the cherubim on each end of it. Make the cherubim part of the cover itself.

20.verse: They must have their wings spread up over the cover. The cherubim must face each other and look toward the cover.

21.verse: Place the cover on top of the ark. I will give you the tablets of the covenant law. Put them in the ark.

22.verse: The ark is where the tablets of the covenant law are kept. I will meet with you above the cover between the two cherubim that are over the ark. There I will give you all my commands for the Israelites.

23.verse: The Table for the Holy Bread - “Make a table out of acacia wood. Make it three feet long, one foot six inches wide and two feet three inches high.

24.verse: Cover it with pure gold. Put a strip of gold around it.

25.verse: Also make a rim around it three inches wide. Put a strip of gold around the rim.

26.verse: Make four gold rings for the table. Join them to the four corners, where the four legs are.

27.verse: The rings must be close to the rim. They must hold the poles that will be used to carry the table.

28.verse: Make the poles out of acacia wood. Cover them with gold. Use them to carry the table.

29.verse: Make its plates and dishes out of pure gold. Also make its pitchers and bowls out of pure gold. Use the pitchers and bowls to pour out drink offerings.

30.verse: Put the holy bread on the table. It must be near my holy throne on the ark of the covenant law at all times.

31.verse: The Gold Lampstand - “Make a lampstand out of pure gold. Hammer out its base and stem. Its buds, blossoms and cups must branch out from it. They must be part of the lampstand itself.

32.verse: Six branches must come out from the sides of the lampstand. Make three on one side and three on the other.

33.verse: On one branch make three cups that are shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms. Then put three on the next branch. Do the same with all six branches that come out from the lampstand.

34.verse: On the lampstand there must be four cups that are shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms.

35.verse: One bud must be under the first pair of branches that come out from the lampstand. Put a second bud under the second pair. And put a third bud under the third pair. Make a total of six branches.

36.verse: The buds and branches must come out from the lampstand. The whole lampstand must be one piece hammered out of pure gold.

37.verse: “Then make its seven lamps. Set them up on it so that they light the space in front of it.

38.verse: The trays and wick cutters must be made out of pure gold.

39.verse: Use 75 pounds of pure gold to make the lampstand and everything used with it.

40.verse: Be sure to make everything just like the pattern I showed you on the mountain.

1.verse: The Holy Tent - “Make ten curtains out of finely twisted linen for the holy tent. Make them with blue, purple and bright red yarn. Have a skilled worker sew cherubim into the pattern.

2.verse: Make all the curtains the same size. They must be 42 feet long and six feet wide.

3.verse: Join five of the curtains together. Do the same thing with the other five.

4.verse: Make loops out of blue strips of cloth along the edge of the end curtain in one set. Do the same thing with the end curtain in the other set.

5.verse: Make 50 loops on the end curtain of the one set. Do the same thing on the end curtain of the other set. Put the loops across from each other.

6.verse: Make 50 gold hooks. Use them to join the curtains together so that the holy tent is all one piece.

7.verse: “Make a total of 11 curtains out of goat hair to put over the holy tent.

8.verse: Make all 11 curtains the same size. They must be 45 feet long and six feet wide.

9.verse: Join five of the curtains together into one set. Do the same thing with the other six. Fold the sixth curtain in half at the front of the tent.

10.verse: Make 50 loops along the edge of the end curtain in the one set. Do the same thing with the other set.

11.verse: Then make 50 bronze hooks. Put them in the loops to join the tent together all in one piece.

12.verse: Let the extra half curtain hang down at the rear of the holy tent.

13.verse: The tent curtains will be 18 inches longer on both sides. What is left over will hang over the sides of the holy tent and cover it.

14.verse: Make a covering for the tent. Make it out of ram skins that are dyed red. Put a covering of the other strong leather over that.

15.verse: “Make frames out of acacia wood for the holy tent.

16.verse: Make each frame 15 feet long and two feet three inches wide.

17.verse: Add two small wooden pins to each frame. Make the pins stick out so that they are even with each other. Make all the frames for the holy tent in the same way.

18.verse: Make 20 frames for the south side of the holy tent.

19.verse: And make 40 silver bases to go under them. Make two bases for each frame. Put one under each pin that sticks out.

20.verse: For the north side of the holy tent make 20 frames

21.verse: and 40 silver bases. Put two bases under each frame.

22.verse: Make six frames for the west end of the holy tent.

23.verse: Make two frames for the corners at the far end.

24.verse: At those two corners the frames must be double from top to bottom. They must be fitted into a single ring. Make both of them the same.

25.verse: There will be eight frames and 16 silver bases. There will be two bases under each frame.

26.verse: “Also make crossbars out of acacia wood. Make five for the frames on one side of the holy tent.

27.verse: Make five for the frames on the other side. And make five for the frames on the west, at the far end of the holy tent.

28.verse: The center crossbar must reach from end to end at the middle of the frames.

29.verse: Cover the frames with gold. Make gold rings to hold the crossbars. Also cover the crossbars with gold.

30.verse: “Set up the holy tent in keeping with the plan I showed you on the mountain.

31.verse: “Make a curtain out of blue, purple and bright red yarn and finely twisted linen. Have a skilled worker sew cherubim into the pattern.

32.verse: Hang the curtain with gold hooks on four posts that are made out of acacia wood. Cover the posts with gold. Stand them on four silver bases.

33.verse: Hang the curtain from the hooks. Place the ark of the covenant law behind the curtain. The curtain will separate the Holy Room from the Most Holy Room.

34.verse: Put the cover on the ark of the covenant law in the Most Holy Room. The cover will be the place where sin is paid for.

35.verse: Place the table outside the curtain on the north side of the holy tent. And put the lampstand across from it on the south side.

36.verse: “Make a curtain for the entrance to the tent. Make it out of blue, purple and bright red yarn and finely twisted linen. Have a person who sews skillfully make it.

37.verse: Make gold hooks for the curtain. Make five posts out of acacia wood. Cover them with gold. And make five bronze bases for them.

1.verse: The Altar for Burnt Offerings - “Build an altar out of acacia wood. It must be four feet six inches high and seven feet six inches square.

2.verse: Make a horn stick out from each of its upper four corners. The horns and the altar must be all one piece. Cover the altar with bronze.

3.verse: Make everything for the altar out of bronze. Make its pots to remove the ashes. Make its shovels, sprinkling bowls, meat forks, and pans for carrying ashes.

4.verse: Make a bronze grate for the altar. Make a bronze ring for each of the four corners of the grate.

5.verse: Put the grate halfway up the altar on the inside.

6.verse: Make poles out of acacia wood for the altar. Cover them with bronze.

7.verse: Put the poles through the rings. They will be on two sides of the altar for carrying it.

8.verse: Make the altar out of boards. Leave it hollow. It must look just like what I showed you on the mountain.

9.verse: The Courtyard - “Make a courtyard for the holy tent. The south side must be 150 feet long. It must have curtains that are made out of finely twisted linen.

10.verse: The curtains must be hung on 20 posts that have 20 bronze bases. The posts must have silver hooks and bands on them.

11.verse: The north side must also be about 150 feet long. It must have curtains with 20 posts that have 20 bronze bases. The posts must have silver hooks and bands on them.

12.verse: “The west end of the courtyard must be 75 feet wide. It must have curtains with ten posts that have ten bases.

13.verse: The east end of the courtyard, toward the sunrise, must also be 75 feet wide.

14.verse: On one side of the entrance you must put curtains that are 22 feet six inches long. Hang them on three posts. Each post must have a base.

15.verse: On the other side you must also put curtains that are 22 feet six inches long. Hang them on three posts. Each post must have a base.

16.verse: “For the entrance to the courtyard, provide a curtain 30 feet long. Make it out of blue, purple and bright red yarn and finely twisted linen. Have someone who sews skillfully make it. Hang it on four posts. Each post must have a base.

17.verse: All the posts that are around the courtyard must have silver bands and hooks. They must also have bronze bases.

18.verse: The courtyard must be 150 feet long and 75 feet wide. It must have curtains that are made out of finely twisted linen. They must be seven feet six inches high. The posts must have bronze bases.

19.verse: Make out of bronze all the other things used for any purpose in the holy tent. That includes all the tent stakes for the tent and the courtyard.

20.verse: Oil for the Lampstand - “Command the Israelites to bring you clear oil made from pressed olives. Use it to keep the lamps burning and giving light.

21.verse: Aaron and his sons must keep the lamps burning in the tent of meeting. The lamps will be outside the curtain in front of the tablets of the covenant law. The lamps must be kept burning in front of the LORD from evening until morning. This is a law for the Israelites that will last for all time to come.

1.verse: The Clothes for the Priests - “Have your brother Aaron brought to you from among the Israelites. His sons Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar must also be brought. They will serve me as priests.

2.verse: Make sacred clothes for your brother Aaron. When he is wearing them, people will honor him. They will have respect for him.

3.verse: Speak to all the skilled workers. I have given them the skill to do this kind of work. Tell them to make clothes for Aaron. He will wear them when he is set apart to serve me as priest.

4.verse: The workers must make a chest cloth, a linen apron and an outer robe. They must also make an inner robe, a turban and a belt. They must make sacred clothes for your brother Aaron and his sons. Then they will serve me as priests.

5.verse: Have the workers use thin gold wire, and blue, purple and bright red yarn, and fine linen.

6.verse: The Linen Apron - “Make the linen apron out of thin gold wire, and out of blue, purple and bright red yarn, and out of finely twisted linen. Have a skilled worker make it.

7.verse: It must have two shoulder straps joined to two of its corners.

8.verse: Its skillfully made waistband must be like the apron. The waistband must be part of the apron itself. Make the waistband out of thin gold wire, and out of blue, purple and bright red yarn, and out of finely twisted linen.

9.verse: “Get two onyx stones. Carve the names of the sons of Israel on them.

10.verse: Arrange them in the order of their birth. Carve six names on one stone and six on the other.

11.verse: Carve the names of the sons of Israel on the two stones the way a jewel cutter would carve them. Then put the stones in fancy gold settings.

12.verse: Connect them to the shoulder straps of the linen apron. The stones will stand for the sons of Israel. Aaron must carry the names on his shoulders as a constant reminder while he is serving the LORD.

13.verse: Make fancy gold settings.

14.verse: Make two braided chains out of pure gold. Make them like ropes. Join the chains to the settings.

15.verse: The Chest Cloth - “Make a chest cloth that will be used for making decisions. Have a skilled worker make it. Make it like the linen apron. Use thin gold wire, and blue, purple and bright red yarn, and finely twisted linen.

16.verse: Make it nine inches square. Fold it in half.

17.verse: Put four rows of valuable jewels on it. Put carnelian, chrysolite and beryl in the first row.

18.verse: Put turquoise, lapis lazuli and emerald in the second row.

19.verse: Put jacinth, agate and amethyst in the third row.

20.verse: And put topaz, onyx and jasper in the fourth row. Put them in fancy gold settings.

21.verse: Use a total of 12 stones. Use one for each of the names of the sons of Israel. Each stone must be carved with the name of one of the 12 tribes.

22.verse: “Make braided chains out of pure gold for the chest cloth. Make them like ropes.

23.verse: Make two gold rings for the chest cloth. Connect them to two corners of it.

24.verse: Join the two gold chains to the rings at the corners of the chest cloth.

25.verse: Join the other ends of the chains to the two settings. Join them to the shoulder straps on the front of the linen apron.

26.verse: Make two gold rings. Connect them to the other two corners of the chest cloth. Put them on the inside edge next to the apron.

27.verse: Make two more gold rings. Connect them to the bottom of the shoulder straps on the front of the apron. Put them close to the seam. Put them right above the waistband of the apron.

28.verse: The rings of the chest cloth must be tied to the rings of the apron. Tie them to the waistband with blue cord. Then the chest cloth will not swing out from the linen apron.

29.verse: “When Aaron enters the Holy Room, he will carry the names of the sons of Israel over his heart. Their names will be on the chest cloth of decision. They will be a continuing reminder while he is serving the LORD.

30.verse: Also put the Urim and Thummim into the chest cloth. Then they will be over Aaron’s heart when he comes to serve the LORD. In that way, Aaron will always have what he needs to make decisions for the people of Israel. He will carry the Urim and Thummim over his heart while he is serving the LORD.

31.verse: More Clothes for the Priests - “Make the outer robe of the linen apron completely out of blue cloth.

32.verse: In the center of the robe, make an opening for the head of the priest. Make an edge like a collar around the opening. Then it will not tear.

33.verse: Make pomegranates out of blue, purple and bright red yarn. Sew them around the hem of the robe. Sew gold bells between them.

34.verse: Sew a gold bell between every two pomegranates all around the hem of the robe.

35.verse: Aaron must wear the robe when he serves as priest. The bells will jingle when he enters the Holy Room while he is serving the LORD. And they will jingle when he goes out. Then he will not die.

36.verse: “Make a plate out of pure gold. Carve words on it as if it were an official seal. Carve the words set apart for the LORD.

37.verse: Tie the plate to the front of the turban with a blue cord.

38.verse: Aaron must wear this plate on his forehead all the time. He will be held responsible for all the sacred gifts the Israelites set apart. Then the LORD will accept the gifts.

39.verse: “Make the inner robe out of fine linen. And make the turban out of fine linen. The belt must be made by a person who sews skillfully.

40.verse: Make inner robes, belts and caps for Aaron’s sons. When they are wearing them, people will honor his sons. They will also have respect for them.

41.verse: Put all these clothes on your brother Aaron and his sons. Then pour olive oil on them and prepare them to serve me. Set them apart to serve me as priests.

42.verse: “Make linen underwear that reaches from the waist to the thigh.

43.verse: Aaron and the priests in his family line must wear it when they enter the tent of meeting. They must also wear it when they approach the altar to serve in the Holy Room. Then they will not be found guilty and die. “For all time to come, that will be a law for Aaron and the priests in his family line.

1.verse: Directions for Setting Apart the Priests - “Here is what you must do to set apart Aaron and his sons to serve me as priests. Get a young bull and two rams. They must not have any flaws.

2.verse: Get the finest wheat flour. Make round loaves of bread that do not have yeast in them. Make thick loaves of bread that do not have yeast in them. Mix olive oil into the thick loaves of bread. Also make thin loaves of bread that do not have yeast in them. Brush the thin loaves with olive oil.

3.verse: Put everything in a basket. Offer them along with the bull and the two rams.

4.verse: Then bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance to the tent of meeting. Wash them with water.

5.verse: Take the inner robe, the outer robe of the linen apron, the apron itself and the chest cloth. Dress Aaron in them. Take the skillfully made waistband and tie the apron on him with it.

6.verse: Put the turban on his head. Connect the sacred plate to the turban.

7.verse: Take the anointing oil and pour it on his head.

8.verse: Bring his sons and dress them in their inner robes.

9.verse: Put caps on their heads. Tie belts on Aaron and his sons. The work of the priests belongs to them. This is my law that will last for all time to come. “Then you must prepare Aaron and his sons to serve me.

10.verse: “Bring the bull to the front of the tent of meeting. Have Aaron and his sons place their hands on its head.

11.verse: Kill it in front of the LORD at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

12.verse: Dip your finger into some of the bull’s blood. Put it on the horns that stick out from the upper four corners of the altar. Pour the rest of it out at the base of the altar.

13.verse: Then take all the fat on the inside parts. Take the long part of the liver. Get both kidneys with the fat on them. And burn all of it on the altar.

14.verse: But burn the bull’s meat, hide and guts outside the camp. It is a sin offering.

15.verse: “Get one of the rams. Have Aaron and his sons place their hands on its head.

16.verse: Kill it. Take the blood and splash it against the sides of the altar.

17.verse: Cut the ram into pieces. Wash the inside parts and the legs. Put them with the head and the other pieces.

18.verse: Then burn the whole ram on the altar. It is a burnt offering to me. It has a pleasant smell. It is a food offering presented to the LORD.

19.verse: “Get the other ram. Have Aaron and his sons place their hands on its head.

20.verse: Kill it. Put some of its blood on the right earlobes of Aaron and his sons. Put some on the thumbs of their right hands. Also put some on the big toes of their right feet. Then splash the blood against the sides of the altar.

21.verse: Get some of the blood from the altar. Also get some of the anointing oil. Sprinkle both of them on Aaron and his clothes and on his sons and their clothes. Then he and his sons and their clothes will be set apart to serve the LORD.

22.verse: “Here is what you must take from this second ram. Take the fat, the fat tail and the fat around the inside parts. Take the long part of the liver. Also take both kidneys with the fat on them, and the right thigh. It is the ram you must use when you prepare the priests to serve the LORD.

23.verse: Get one round loaf of bread and one thick loaf of bread with olive oil mixed in. Also get one thin loaf of bread. Take them from the basket of bread made without yeast. It is the one in front of the LORD.

24.verse: Put all these things in the hands of Aaron and his sons. Tell them to lift them up and wave them in front of the LORD as a wave offering.

25.verse: Then take all these things from their hands. Burn them on the altar along with the burnt offering. Its smell pleases the LORD. It is a food offering presented to the LORD.

26.verse: Get the breast of the ram used when you prepare Aaron to serve the LORD. Wave it in front of the LORD as a wave offering. It will be your share of the meat.

27.verse: “Here are the parts of the second ram that belong to Aaron and his sons. You must set apart the breast that was waved and the thigh that was offered.

28.verse: It will be the regular share from the Israelites for Aaron and his sons. The people must give it to the LORD from their friendship offerings.

29.verse: “Aaron’s sacred clothes will belong to his sons who will come after him. Then they can wear them when you anoint them and prepare them to serve the LORD.

30.verse: The son who comes after Aaron as priest must wear them seven days. He will come and serve in the Holy Room in the tent of meeting.

31.verse: “Get the ram sacrificed when you prepare Aaron and his sons to serve the LORD. Cook the meat in a sacred place.

32.verse: Aaron and his sons must eat the ram’s meat. And they must eat the bread in the basket. They must eat all of it at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

33.verse: These are the offerings to pay for their sins. They must eat them. The offerings must be made when Aaron and his sons are set apart and prepared to serve the LORD. No one else can eat them. They are sacred.

34.verse: When you prepare Aaron and his sons to serve me, you will sacrifice the ram and the bread. If any parts of the ram or bread are left until morning, burn them up. They must not be eaten. They are sacred.

35.verse: “Do everything I have commanded you to do for Aaron and his sons. Take seven days when you prepare them to serve the LORD.

36.verse: Sacrifice a bull each day. It is a sin offering to pay for their sins. Make the altar pure. Pour olive oil on it to set it apart.

37.verse: Take seven days to make the altar pure. Set it apart. Then the altar will be a very holy place. Anything that touches it will be holy.

38.verse: “Every day sacrifice on the altar two lambs that are a year old.

39.verse: Sacrifice one in the morning and the other one when the sun goes down.

40.verse: Along with the first lamb, offer three and a half pounds of fine flour. Mix it with a quart of oil made from pressed olives. Along with that, sacrifice a quart of wine as a drink offering.

41.verse: Sacrifice the other lamb when the sun goes down. Sacrifice it along with the same grain offering and its drink offering as you do in the morning. It has a pleasant smell. It is a food offering presented to the LORD.

42.verse: “For all time to come, this burnt offering must be sacrificed regularly. Sacrifice it at the entrance to the tent of meeting in front of the LORD. There I will meet with you and speak to you.

43.verse: There I will also meet with the people of Israel. My glory will make the place holy.

44.verse: “So I will set apart the tent of meeting and the altar. And I will set apart Aaron and his sons to serve me as priests.

45.verse: Then I will live among the people of Israel. And I will be their God.

46.verse: They will know that I am the LORD their God. They will know that I brought them out of Egypt so I could live among them. I am the LORD their God.

1.verse: The Altar for Burning Incense - “Make an altar for burning incense. Make it out of acacia wood.

2.verse: It must be one and a half feet square and three feet high. Make a horn stick out from each of its upper four corners.

3.verse: Cover the top, sides and horns with pure gold. Put a strip of gold around it.

4.verse: Make two gold rings for the altar below the strip. Put the rings across from each other. They will hold the poles that are used to carry it.

5.verse: Make the poles out of acacia wood. Cover them with gold.

6.verse: Put the altar in front of the curtain that hangs in front of the ark. The ark is where the tablets of the covenant law are kept. The ark will have a cover. It will be the place where sin is paid for. There I will meet with you.

7.verse: “Aaron must burn sweet-smelling incense on the altar. He must do it every morning when he takes care of the lamps.

8.verse: He must burn incense again when he lights the lamps at sunset. Incense must be burned regularly in front of the LORD. Do it for all time to come.

9.verse: Do not burn any other incense on the altar. Do not use the altar for burnt offerings or grain offerings. And do not pour drink offerings on it.

10.verse: Once a year Aaron must put the blood of a sin offering on the horns of the altar. He must do this to make the altar pure. He must do this on the day Israel’s sin is paid for. Do this for all time to come. The altar is a very holy place to me.”

11.verse: Money to Pay for the People’s Lives - Then the LORD spoke to Moses. He said,

12.verse: “Make a list of the Israelites and count them. When you do, each one must pay the LORD for his life at the time he is counted. Then a plague will not come on them when you count them.

13.verse: Each one counted must pay a fifth of an ounce of silver. It must be weighed out in keeping with the standard weights that are used in the sacred tent. The payment is an offering to the LORD.

14.verse: Each one counted must be 20 years old or more. He must give an offering to the LORD.

15.verse: When you make the offering, rich people must not give more than a fifth of an ounce of silver. And poor people must not give less. The offering you give to the LORD will pay for your lives.

16.verse: Receive the money from the people of Israel. Use it for any purpose in the tent of meeting. It will remind the people that they are paying me for their lives.”

17.verse: The Large Bowl for Washing - Then the LORD spoke to Moses. He said,

18.verse: “Make a large bronze bowl for washing. Make a bronze stand to put it on. Place the bowl between the tent of meeting and the altar. Put water in it.

19.verse: Aaron and his sons must wash their hands and feet with water from it.

20.verse: When they enter the tent of meeting, they must wash with water so that they will not die. They will come to the altar to serve me. They will bring a food offering to the LORD.

21.verse: When they do, they must wash their hands and feet so that they will not die. For all time to come, that will be a law for Aaron and the priests in his family line.”

22.verse: Anointing Oil - Then the LORD said to Moses,

23.verse: “Get some fine spices. Get 12 pounds eight ounces of liquid myrrh. Get six pounds four ounces of sweet-smelling cinnamon and the same amount of sweet-smelling calamus.

24.verse: Also get 12 pounds eight ounces of cassia. All the spices must be weighed out in keeping with the standard weights that are used in the sacred tent. And get a gallon of olive oil.

25.verse: Have a person who makes perfume mix everything into a sacred anointing oil. It will smell sweet.

26.verse: Then use it to anoint the tent of meeting and the ark where the tablets of the covenant law are kept.

27.verse: Anoint the table for the holy bread and all its things. Anoint the lampstand and the things that are used with it. Anoint the altar for burning incense.

28.verse: Anoint the altar for burnt offerings and all its tools. And anoint the large bowl together with its stand.

29.verse: You must set them apart so that they will be very holy. Anything that touches them will be holy.

30.verse: “Anoint Aaron and his sons. Set them apart so that they can serve me as priests.

31.verse: Say to the people of Israel, ‘This will be my sacred anointing oil for all time to come.

32.verse: Do not pour it on anyone else’s body. Do not make any other oil in the same way. It is sacred. So you must think of it as sacred.

33.verse: Suppose a person makes perfume in the same way. And suppose that person puts it on someone who is not a priest. Then that person must be separated from their people.’ ”

34.verse: Incense - Then the LORD said to Moses, “Get some sweet-smelling spices. Get some gum resin, onycha and galbanum. Also get some pure frankincense. Make sure everything is in equal amounts.

35.verse: Have a person who makes perfume mix it all up into a sweet-smelling incense. It must have salt in it. It will be pure and sacred.

36.verse: Grind some of it into powder. Place it in front of the ark of the covenant law in the tent of meeting. There I will meet with you. The incense will be very holy to you.

37.verse: Do not make any incense for yourselves in the same way. Think of it as holy to the LORD.

38.verse: Whoever makes incense in the same way to enjoy its sweet smell must be separated from their people.”

1.verse: Bezalel and Oholiab - Then the LORD spoke to Moses.

2.verse: He said, “I have chosen Bezalel, the son of Uri. Uri is the son of Hur. Bezalel is from the tribe of Judah.

3.verse: I have filled him with the Spirit of God. I have filled Bezalel with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skill.

4.verse: He can make beautiful patterns in gold, silver and bronze.

5.verse: He can cut and set stones. He can work with wood. In fact, he can work in all kinds of crafts.

6.verse: I have also appointed Oholiab, the son of Ahisamak, to help him. Oholiab is from the tribe of Dan. I have given ability to all the skilled workers. They can make everything I have commanded you to make. Here is the complete list.

7.verse: “the tent of meeting the ark where the tablets of the covenant law are kept the cover for the ark

8.verse: the table for the holy bread and its things the pure gold lampstand and everything used with it the altar for burning incense

9.verse: the altar for burnt offerings and all its tools the large bowl with its stand

10.verse: the sacred clothes for Aaron the priest the clothes for his sons when they serve as priests

11.verse: the anointing oil the sweet-smelling incense for the Holy Room “The skilled workers must make them just as I commanded you.”

12.verse: The Sabbath Day - Then the LORD spoke to Moses.

13.verse: He said, “Tell the people of Israel, ‘You must always keep my Sabbath days. That will be the sign of the covenant I have made between me and you for all time to come. Then you will know that I am the LORD. I am the one who makes you holy.

14.verse: “ ‘Keep the Sabbath day. It is holy to you. Those who misuse it must be put to death. Those who do any work on that day must be separated from their people.

15.verse: Do your work in six days. But the seventh day is a day of sabbath rest. You must rest on it. It is set apart for the LORD. Those who work on the Sabbath day must be put to death.

16.verse: The Israelites must keep the Sabbath day. They must celebrate it for all time to come. It will be a covenant that lasts forever.

17.verse: It will be the sign of the covenant I have made between me and the Israelites forever. The LORD made the heavens and the earth in six days. But on the seventh day he did not work. He rested.’ ”

18.verse: The LORD finished speaking to Moses on Mount Sinai. Then he gave him the two tablets of the covenant law. They were made out of stone. The words on them were written by the finger of God.

1.verse: Israel Worships a Golden Calf - The people saw that Moses took a long time to come down from the mountain. So they gathered around Aaron. They said to him, “Come. Make us a god that will lead us. This fellow Moses brought us up out of Egypt. But we don’t know what has happened to him.”

2.verse: Aaron answered them, “Take the gold earrings off your wives, your sons and your daughters. Bring the earrings to me.”

3.verse: So all the people took off their earrings. They brought them to Aaron.

4.verse: He took what they gave him and made it into a metal statue of a god. It looked like a calf. Aaron shaped it with a tool. Then the people said, “Israel, here is your god who brought you up out of Egypt.”

5.verse: When Aaron saw what they were doing, he built an altar in front of the calf. He said, “Tomorrow will be a feast day to honor the LORD.”

6.verse: So the next day the people got up early. They sacrificed burnt offerings and brought friendship offerings. They sat down to eat and drink. Then they got up to dance wildly in front of their god.

7.verse: The LORD spoke to Moses. He said, “Go down. Your people you brought up out of Egypt have become very sinful.

8.verse: They have quickly turned away from what I commanded them. They have made themselves a metal statue of a god in the shape of a calf. They have bowed down and sacrificed to it. And they have said, ‘Israel, here is your god who brought you up out of Egypt.’

9.verse: “I have seen these people,” the LORD said to Moses. “They are stubborn.

10.verse: Now leave me alone. I will destroy them because of my great anger. Then I will make you into a great nation.”

11.verse: But Moses asked the LORD his God to have mercy on the people. “LORD,” he said, “why should you destroy your people in anger? You used your great power and mighty hand to bring them out of Egypt.

12.verse: Why should the Egyptians say, ‘He brought them out to hurt them. He wanted to kill them in the mountains. He wanted to wipe them off the face of the earth’? Turn away from your great anger. Please take pity on your people. Don’t destroy them!

13.verse: Remember your servants Abraham, Isaac and Israel. You made a promise to them in your own name. You said, ‘I will make your children after you as many as the stars in the sky. I will give them all this land I promised them. It will belong to them forever.’ ”

14.verse: Then the LORD took pity on his people. He didn’t destroy them as he had said he would.

15.verse: Moses turned and went down the mountain. He had the two tablets of the covenant law in his hands. Words were written on both sides of the tablets, front and back.

16.verse: The tablets were the work of God. The words had been written by God. They had been carved on the tablets.

17.verse: Joshua heard the noise of the people shouting. So he said to Moses, “It sounds like war in the camp.”

18.verse: Moses replied, “It’s not the sound of winning. It’s not the sound of losing. It’s the sound of singing that I hear.”

19.verse: As Moses approached the camp, he saw the calf. He also saw the people dancing. So he was very angry. He threw the tablets out of his hands. They broke into pieces at the foot of the mountain.

20.verse: He took the calf the people had made. He burned it in the fire. Then he ground it into powder. He scattered it on the water. And he made the Israelites drink it.

21.verse: He said to Aaron, “What did these people do to you? How did they make you lead them into such terrible sin?”

22.verse: “Please don’t be angry,” Aaron answered. “You know how these people like to do what is evil.

23.verse: They said to me, ‘Make us a god that will lead us. This fellow Moses brought us up out of Egypt. But we don’t know what has happened to him.’

24.verse: So I told them, ‘Anyone who has any gold jewelry, take it off.’ They gave me the gold. I threw it into the fire. And out came this calf!”

25.verse: Moses saw that the people were running wild. Aaron had let them get out of control. The people had become a joke to their enemies.

26.verse: Moses stood at the entrance to the camp. He said, “Anyone on the LORD’s side, come to me.” All the Levites joined him.

27.verse: Then he spoke to them. He said, “The LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘Each man must put on his sword. Then he must go back and forth through the camp from one end to the other. Each man must kill his brother and friend and neighbor.’ ”

28.verse: The Levites did as Moses commanded. About 3,000 of the people died that day.

29.verse: Then Moses said to the Levites, “You have been set apart for the LORD today. You fought against your own sons and brothers. And he has blessed you this day.”

30.verse: The next day Moses said to the people, “You have committed a terrible sin. But now I will go up to the LORD. Maybe if I pray to him, he will forgive your sin.”

31.verse: So Moses went back to the LORD. He said, “These people have committed a terrible sin. They have made a god out of gold for themselves.

32.verse: Now please forgive their sin. But if you won’t, then erase my name out of the book you have written.”

33.verse: The LORD replied to Moses. The LORD said, “I will erase out of my book only the names of those who have sinned against me.

34.verse: Now go. Lead the people to the place I spoke about. My angel will go ahead of you. But when the time comes for me to punish, I will punish them for their sin.”

35.verse: The LORD struck the people with a plague. That’s because of what they did with the calf Aaron had made.

1.verse: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Leave this place. You and the people you brought up out of Egypt must leave it. Go up to the land I promised to give to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. I said to them, ‘I will give it to your children after you.’

2.verse: I will send an angel ahead of you. I will drive out the Canaanites, Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.

3.verse: Go up to the land that has plenty of milk and honey. But I will not go with you. You are stubborn. I might destroy you on the way.”

4.verse: When the people heard these painful words, they began to mourn. No one put on any jewelry.

5.verse: The LORD had said to Moses, “Tell the Israelites, ‘You are stubborn. If I went with you even for a moment, I might destroy you. Now take off your jewelry. Then I will decide what to do with you.’ ”

6.verse: So the people took off their jewelry at Mount Horeb.

7.verse: The Tent of Meeting - Moses used to take a tent and set it up far outside the camp. He called it the “tent of meeting.” Anyone who wanted to ask the LORD a question would go to the tent of meeting outside the camp.

8.verse: When Moses would go out to the tent, everyone would get up and stand at the entrances to their tents. They would watch Moses until he entered the tent.

9.verse: As Moses would go into the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down. It would stay at the entrance while the LORD spoke with Moses.

10.verse: The people would see the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance to the tent. Then all of them would stand and worship at the entrances to their tents.

11.verse: The LORD would speak to Moses face to face like one would speak to a friend. Then Moses would return to the camp. But Joshua, his young helper, didn’t leave the tent. Joshua was the son of Nun.

12.verse: Moses and the Glory of the LORD - Moses said to the LORD, “You have been telling me, ‘Lead these people.’ But you haven’t let me know whom you will send with me. You have said, ‘I know your name. I know all about you. And I am pleased with you.’

13.verse: If you are pleased with me, teach me more about yourself. Then I can know you. And I can continue to please you. Remember that this nation is your people.”

14.verse: The LORD replied, “I will go with you. And I will give you rest.”

15.verse: Then Moses said to him, “If you don’t go with us, don’t send us up from here.

16.verse: How will anyone know that you are pleased with me and your people? You must go with us. How else will we be different from all the other people on the face of the earth?”

17.verse: The LORD said to Moses, “I will do exactly what you have asked. I am pleased with you. And I know your name. I know all about you.”

18.verse: Then Moses said, “Now show me your glory.”

19.verse: The LORD said, “I will make all my goodness pass in front of you. And I will announce my name, the LORD, in front of you. I will have mercy on whom I have mercy. And I will show love to those I love.

20.verse: But you can’t see my face,” he said. “No one can see me and stay alive.”

21.verse: The LORD continued, “There is a place near me where you can stand on a rock.

22.verse: When my glory passes by, I will put you in an opening in the rock. I will cover you with my hand until I have passed by.

23.verse: Then I will remove my hand. You will see my back. But my face must not be seen.”

1.verse: The New Stone Tablets - The LORD said to Moses, “Cut out two stone tablets that are just like the first ones. I will write on them the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.

2.verse: Be ready in the morning. Then come up on Mount Sinai. Meet with me there on top of the mountain.

3.verse: No one must come with you. No one must be seen anywhere on the mountain. Not even the flocks and herds must be allowed to eat grass in front of the mountain.”

4.verse: So Moses carved out two stone tablets just like the first ones. Early in the morning he went up Mount Sinai. He carried the two stone tablets in his hands. He did as the LORD had commanded him to do.

5.verse: Then the LORD came down in the cloud. He stood there with Moses and announced his name, the LORD.

6.verse: As he passed in front of Moses, he called out. He said, “I am the LORD, the LORD. I am the God who is tender and kind. I am gracious. I am slow to get angry. I am faithful and full of love.

7.verse: I continue to show my love to thousands of people. I forgive those who do evil. I forgive those who refuse to obey me. And I forgive those who sin. But I do not let guilty people go without punishing them. I cause the sins of the parents to affect their children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren.”

8.verse: Moses bowed down to the ground at once and worshiped.

9.verse: “Lord,” he said, “if you are pleased with me, then go with us. Even though these people are stubborn, forgive the evil things we have done. Forgive our sin. And accept us as your people.”

10.verse: Then the LORD said, “I am making a covenant with you. I will do wonderful things in front of all your people. I will do amazing things that have never been done before in any nation in the whole world. The people you live among will see the things that I, the LORD, will do for you. And they will see how wonderful those things really are.

11.verse: Obey what I command you today. I will drive out the Amorites, Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites to make room for you.

12.verse: Be careful. Do not make a peace treaty with those who live in the land where you are going. They will be a trap to you.

13.verse: Break down their altars. Smash their sacred stones. Cut down the poles they use to worship the female god named Asherah.

14.verse: Do not worship any other god. The LORD is a jealous God. In fact, his name is Jealous.

15.verse: “Be careful not to make a peace treaty with the people living in the land. They commit sin by offering sacrifices to their gods. They will invite you to eat their sacrifices, and you will do it.

16.verse: You will choose some of their daughters as wives for your sons. And those daughters will commit sin by worshiping their gods. Then they will lead your sons to do the same thing.

17.verse: “Do not make any statues of gods.

18.verse: “Celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days eat bread made without yeast, just as I commanded you. Do it at the appointed time in the month of Aviv. You came out of Egypt in that month.

19.verse: “Every male animal born first to its mother belongs to me. That includes your livestock. It includes herds and flocks alike.

20.verse: Sacrifice a lamb to buy back every male donkey born first to its mother. But if you do not buy the donkey back, break its neck. Buy back all your oldest sons. “You must not come to worship me with your hands empty.

21.verse: “Do your work in six days. But you must rest on the seventh day. Even when you are plowing your land or gathering your crops, you must rest on the seventh day.

22.verse: “Celebrate the Feast of Weeks. Bring the first share of your wheat crop. Celebrate the Feast of Booths. Hold it in the fall.

23.verse: Three times a year all your men must come to worship me. I am your LORD and King, the God of Israel.

24.verse: I will drive out nations ahead of you. I will increase your territory. Go up three times a year to worship me. While you are doing that, I will keep others from wanting to take any of your land for themselves. I am the LORD your God.

25.verse: “Do not include anything made with yeast when you offer me the blood of a sacrifice. You must not keep any of the meat from the sacrifice of the Passover Feast until morning.

26.verse: “Bring the best of the first share of your crops to the house of the LORD your God. “Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.”

27.verse: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Write down the words I have spoken. I have made a covenant with you and with Israel in keeping with those words.”

28.verse: Moses was there with the LORD for 40 days and 40 nights. He didn’t eat any food or drink any water. The LORD wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant law. Those words are the Ten Commandments.

29.verse: The Face of Moses Shines - Moses came down from Mount Sinai. He had the two tablets of the covenant law in his hands. His face was shining because he had spoken with the LORD. But he didn’t realize it.

30.verse: Aaron and all the people of Israel saw Moses. His face was shining. So they were afraid to come near him.

31.verse: But Moses called out to them. So Aaron and all the leaders of the community came to him. And Moses spoke to them.

32.verse: After that, all the Israelites came near him. And he gave them all the commands the LORD had given him on Mount Sinai.

33.verse: Moses finished speaking to them. Then he covered his face with a veil.

34.verse: But when he would go to speak with the LORD, he would remove the veil. He would keep it off until he came out. Then he would tell the people what the LORD had commanded.

35.verse: They would see that his face was shining. So Moses would cover his face with the veil again. He would keep it on until he went in again to speak with the LORD.

1.verse: Rules for the Sabbath Day - Moses gathered the whole community of Israel together. He said to them, “Here are the things the LORD has commanded you to do.

2.verse: You must do your work in six days. But the seventh day will be your holy day. It will be a day of sabbath rest to honor the LORD. You must rest on it. Anyone who does any work on it must be put to death.

3.verse: Do not even light a fire in any of your homes on the Sabbath day.”

4.verse: Supplies for the Holy Tent - Moses spoke to the whole community of Israel. He said, “Here is what the LORD has commanded.

5.verse: Take an offering for the LORD from what you have. Those who want to can bring an offering to the LORD. Here is what they can bring. “gold, silver and bronze

6.verse: blue, purple and bright red yarn and fine linen goat hair

7.verse: ram skins that are dyed red another kind of strong leather acacia wood

8.verse: olive oil for the lights spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet-smelling incense

9.verse: onyx stones and other jewels for the linen apron and the chest cloth

10.verse: “All the skilled workers among you must come. They must make everything the LORD has commanded

11.verse: for the holy tent and its covering. Here is what they must make. “hooks, frames, crossbars, posts, bases

12.verse: the ark of the covenant law, the poles and cover for the ark, and the curtain that hides the ark

13.verse: the table for the holy bread, the poles and all the things for the table, and the holy bread

14.verse: the lampstand for light and everything used with it, the lamps, and the olive oil that gives light

15.verse: the altar for burning incense, the poles for the altar, the anointing oil and the sweet-smelling incense the curtain for the entrance to the holy tent

16.verse: the altar for burnt offerings with its bronze grate, its poles and all its tools the large bronze bowl with its stand

17.verse: the curtains of the courtyard with their posts and bases, and the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard

18.verse: the ropes and tent stakes for the holy tent and for the courtyard

19.verse: and the sacred clothes for Aaron the priest and the clothes for his sons when they serve as priests”

20.verse: Then the whole community of Israel left Moses.

21.verse: Everyone who wanted to give offerings to the LORD brought them to him. The offerings were for the work on the tent of meeting. They were also for the sacred clothes and for any other purpose at the tent.

22.verse: Every man and woman who wanted to give came. They brought gold jewelry of all kinds. They brought pins, earrings, rings and other jewelry. All of them gave their gold as a wave offering to the LORD.

23.verse: People brought what they had. They brought blue, purple or bright red yarn or fine linen. They brought goat hair, ram skins dyed red, or the other kind of strong leather.

24.verse: Some brought silver or bronze as an offering to the LORD. Others brought acacia wood for any part of the work.

25.verse: All the skilled women spun yarn with their hands. They brought blue, purple or bright red yarn or fine linen.

26.verse: All the skilled women who wanted to spin the goat hair did so.

27.verse: The leaders brought onyx stones and other jewels for the linen apron and the chest cloth.

28.verse: They also brought spices and olive oil. They brought them for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the sweet-smelling incense.

29.verse: All the men and women of Israel who wanted to bring offerings to the LORD brought them to him. The offerings were for all the work the LORD had commanded Moses to tell them to do.

30.verse: Bezalel and Oholiab - Then Moses spoke to the people of Israel. He said, “The LORD has chosen Bezalel, the son of Uri. Uri is the son of Hur. Bezalel is from the tribe of Judah.

31.verse: The LORD has filled him with the Spirit of God. He has filled him with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skill.

32.verse: Bezalel can make beautiful patterns in gold, silver and bronze.

33.verse: He can cut and set stones. He can work with wood. In fact, he can work in all kinds of arts and crafts.

34.verse: And the LORD has given both him and Oholiab the ability to teach others. Oholiab, the son of Ahisamak, is from the tribe of Dan.

35.verse: The LORD has filled Bezalel and Oholiab with skill to do all kinds of work. They can carve things and make patterns. They can sew skillfully with blue, purple and bright red yarn and on fine linen. They use thread to make beautiful cloth. Both of them have the skill to work in all kinds of crafts.

1.verse: Bezalel and Oholiab must do the work just as the LORD has commanded. So must every skilled worker to whom the LORD has given skill and ability. They know how to do all the work for every purpose connected with the sacred tent. And that includes setting it up.”

2.verse: Then Moses sent for Bezalel and Oholiab. He sent for every skilled worker to whom the LORD had given ability and who wanted to come and do the work.

3.verse: They received from Moses all the offerings the people of Israel had brought. They had brought the offerings for all the work for every purpose connected with the holy tent. That included setting it up. The people kept bringing the offerings they chose to give. They brought them morning after morning.

4.verse: So all the skilled workers working on the holy tent stopped what they were doing.

5.verse: They said to Moses, “The LORD commanded us to do the work. And the people are bringing more than enough for us to do it.”

6.verse: Then Moses gave an order. A message was sent through the whole camp. It said, “No man or woman should make anything else and offer it for the holy tent.” And so the people were kept from bringing more offerings.

7.verse: There was already more than enough to do all the work.

8.verse: The Holy Tent - All the skilled workers made the holy tent. They made ten curtains out of finely twisted linen. They made them with blue, purple and bright red yarn. A skilled worker sewed cherubim into the pattern.

9.verse: All the curtains were the same size. They were 42 feet long and six feet wide.

10.verse: The workers joined five of the curtains together. They did the same thing with the other five.

11.verse: Then they made loops out of blue strips of cloth along the edge of the end curtain in one set. They did the same thing with the end curtain in the other set.

12.verse: They also made 50 loops on the end curtain of the one set. They did the same thing on the end curtain of the other set. They put the loops across from each other.

13.verse: Then they made 50 gold hooks. They used them to join the two sets of curtains together so that the holy tent was all one piece.

14.verse: The workers made a total of 11 curtains out of goat hair to put over the holy tent.

15.verse: All 11 curtains were the same size. They were 45 feet long and six feet wide.

16.verse: The workers joined five of the curtains together into one set. They did the same thing with the other six.

17.verse: Then they made 50 loops along the edge of the end curtain in the one set. They did the same thing with the other set.

18.verse: They made 50 bronze hooks. They used them to join the tent together all in one piece.

19.verse: They made a covering for the tent. They made it out of ram skins dyed red. Over that, they put a covering of another kind of strong leather.

20.verse: The workers made frames out of acacia wood for the holy tent.

21.verse: Each frame was about 15 feet long and two feet three inches wide.

22.verse: The workers added two small wooden pins to each frame. The pins stuck out so that they were even with each other. The workers made all the frames of the holy tent in the same way.

23.verse: The workers made 20 frames for the south side of the holy tent.

24.verse: And they made 40 silver bases to go under them. They made two bases for each frame. They put one under each pin that stuck out.

25.verse: For the north side of the holy tent they made 20 frames

26.verse: and 40 silver bases. They put two bases under each frame.

27.verse: The workers made six frames for the west end of the holy tent.

28.verse: They made two frames for the corners of the holy tent at the far end.

29.verse: At those two corners the frames were double from top to bottom. They were fitted into a single ring. The workers made both of them the same.

30.verse: So there were eight frames and 16 silver bases. There were two bases under each frame.

31.verse: The workers also made crossbars out of acacia wood. They made five for the frames on one side of the holy tent.

32.verse: They made five for the frames on the other side. And they made five for the frames on the west, at the far end of the holy tent.

33.verse: The center crossbar reached from end to end at the middle of the frames.

34.verse: The workers covered the frames with gold. They made gold rings to hold the crossbars. They also covered the crossbars with gold.

35.verse: They made the curtain out of blue, purple and bright red yarn and finely twisted linen. A skilled worker sewed cherubim into the pattern.

36.verse: The workers made four posts out of acacia wood for the curtain. They covered the posts with gold. They made gold hooks and four silver bases for the posts.

37.verse: For the entrance to the tent the workers made a curtain. They made it out of blue, purple and bright red yarn and finely twisted linen. A person who sewed skillfully made it.

38.verse: The workers made five posts with hooks for the curtains. They covered the tops of the posts and their bands with gold. And they made five bronze bases for them.

1.verse: The Ark of the Covenant Law - Bezalel made the ark of the covenant law out of acacia wood. It was three feet nine inches long and two feet three inches wide and high.

2.verse: He covered it inside and outside with pure gold. He put a strip of gold around it.

3.verse: He made four gold rings for it. He joined them to its four bottom corners. He put two rings on one side and two rings on the other.

4.verse: Then he made poles out of acacia wood. He covered them with gold.

5.verse: He put the poles through the rings on the sides of the ark to carry it.

6.verse: He made its cover out of pure gold. It was three feet nine inches long and two feet three inches wide. The cover is the place where sin is paid for.

7.verse: Then he made two cherubim out of hammered gold at the ends of the cover.

8.verse: He put one of the cherubim on each end of it.

9.verse: He made them as part of the cover itself. Their wings spread up over the cover. The cherubim faced each other and looked toward the cover.

10.verse: The Table for the Holy Bread - The workers made the table out of acacia wood. It was three feet long, one foot six inches wide and two feet three inches high.

11.verse: Then they covered it with pure gold. They put a strip of gold around it.

12.verse: They also made a rim around it three inches wide. They put a strip of gold around the rim.

13.verse: They made four gold rings for the table. They joined them to the four corners, where the four legs were.

14.verse: The rings were close to the rim. The rings held the poles used to carry the table.

15.verse: The workers made the poles out of acacia wood. They covered them with gold.

16.verse: They made plates, dishes and bowls out of pure gold for the table. They also made pure gold pitchers to pour out drink offerings.

17.verse: The Gold Lampstand - The workers made the lampstand out of pure gold. They hammered out its base and stem. Its buds, blossoms and cups branched out from it.

18.verse: Six branches came out from the sides of the lampstand. There were three on one side and three on the other.
